content: ditty bags pattern fun little bags to make with 100 yards of yarn for a long time i have wanted a little bag to hold my little spinning tools it needs to be something that will stay with my wheel i am incredibly good at misplacing things especially small items enter the ditty bag what is a ditty bag traditionally it was a small bag that sailors kept their sewing supplies in my husband knows of it as a small bag for shaving supplies he is a shaving enthusiast i set out to make a spinning ditty bag and thought i d share what i learned it could be a lovely little evening bag silk yarn and beads or a cute bag for a child to see larger versions of the pictures go to http //maiaspins typepad com/maiaspins/2009/03/ditty-bag html and click on any picture all three bags are based on a 60 stitch tube you can mix and match the bases and top edges or add a pattern stitch i used sock yarn leftovers they could be made with multiple yarns stripes or handspun i am resisting the urge to make more and try these ideas myself if you want to make the bag larger or smaller use a multiple of 12 stitches the eyelet holes define this it is a 6 stitch repeat and you need an even number of eyelets for the cord this picot edge is a version i have not seen elsewhere i was without my usual tools again i really need these bags to keep me organized so i improvised and was delightfully satisfied with the result no provisional cast on required difficulty this pattern is appropriate for beginning knitters that can knit in the round materials 100 yards of sport or fingering weight yarn shown in tactile superwash merino sport weight purple bag is eggplant colorway and red bag is pomegranate colorway and tactile superwash fingering weight yellow bag in meyer lemon colorway set of 5 double
